reviews.review_msg: His slides lack the information needed to properly explain the material and he does not do a great job of explaining things clearly either. He lectures in a way that assumes you already know the material. A lot of people got less than 40% on the final.
Great lectures.

Dr Branda is by far the best prof I have ever had! He comes off as a little intimidating but if you show interest, he is actually very caring. No office hours so ask during class. He is a very sweet man and will help you get good grades if you are willing to work for them. 2nd MT was HARD but final was easy! Just work for it!
very good lecturer. the midterms were fair but hard. the final exam was just brutal. prepare yourself for alot of headaches. I would recommend this prof to anyone taking organic chemistry.

Great presenter, very basic lecture notes lacking whats needed to know on exams, definitely use a lot of external resources (videos, practice questions), cocky annoying know it all who thinks everything is easy - of course it's easy for the prof, very very difficult exams, midterm was okay, final was death, one of the worst profs I've ever had

He has very clear notes. He doesn't focus on mechanisms but more on "here is the final product, what were the reactans". His lectures went by fast. I recommend using his notes as a starting point and find youtube videos that explain the topic in more detail. The class averages were 50-60%. Obviously the best prof at teaching o-chem.

Neil's powerpoint slides are everything. They're nice and clear because he didn't attempt to hand-draw chemical structures. He also loves to get distracted and talks about the chemistry in the real world so his lectures never really get boring. He's a genius and is one of those profs who knows what they're talking about and can actually explain it.

Best prof I have ever had. His lectures are clear and his exams are fair. He is the reason I now love chemistry. Would highly recommend taking a course with him. The only reason to have a text book is to do problems out of, which I'm sure you can probably find online anyways
His lectures are very clear and concise, shows a lot of real-world examples for reactions... He doesn't provide too much detail for each reaction so it's best to review them in a textbook after

worth waiting for him to teach ochem2, the lectures are full of real world examples and makes the lecture like something you cant wait for. Clear about what to expect on the exam. Usually ochem is nightmare but neil gives you the confidence to do well in the class. Again it will be worth waiting for him to teach the class.

It took less than a lecture for myself and many other students to realize we were in the presence of a true genius - something rare even among professors. Unparalleled mastery of the material. Very to the point. Emphasized understanding and tested on it. Provided context and humor to engage. Not at all arrogant. Just wish he had office hours.

Great professor. He always started class by showing us real world applications to what we would be learning that day. Classes always went by in a flash. Tests were difficult as you had to say the one specific key word to get any marks at all. Chem 282 is easy for some, and hard for others. Branda, keeps it fun for everyone.

Knows what he's talking about. The exams require original thought and problem solving. So if you just went through the lecture notes you'll get stuck on the exam unless you understand a certain amount of theory... and obviously you need to memorize certain reactions. Do lots of problems and you should be OK.

Knows his stuff, but does not know how to teach. His explanation for a questions was: "just push electrons around". He makes the chemistry seem a lot easier than it is and his testproblem sets are really difficult. Each question is worth 10+ marks
Best chem prof ever. He's so enthusiastic and passionate; it makes lectures fun and interesting. Great teaching style-he explains concepts really well. Funny guy!

He is an amazing lecturer. The course content was pretty difficult but very interesting in my opinion! First ten minutes of class were the best! (he chose interesting chemistry related topics used in everyday life)
Hard material,  but notes were provided and there was no need to use the textbook.
He's the man.

Wonderful Prof, Great at explaining the material, super clear notes, and straightforward tests. Actually made me like Chemistry . The class is still one of the hardest intro science courses, so you will  need to put in the work.

Seriously great prof. This is a tough class. If you don't put in the time, you won't get the mark. I got 63% on my midterm for silly mistakes, class average was 62%. The midterm was straight forward, no tricks. He makes you understand the reasoning behind the importance of chemistry and its impacts in our everyday life. 100% recommended prof.
hilarious easy-going prof!
Exceptionally prof.  Great notes and funny too.
Best prof for chemistry, hands down!
Awesome.
No Comments
p
man..i miss this guy so much although i'm takin 282 with other prof..
Best chem 281 professor ever.  He'll actually teach you the important stuff like the concepts behind chemistry and not just how to memorize a book-load of crap like other chem profs.

MAN! he makes other profs look bad. He's by far the BEST organic chem prof at SFU - very clear, passionate about teaching (too bad "clarity" and "helpfulness" is only out of 5-I would give him a 10)and VERY helpful during office hours. I HIGHLY recommend him for organic chem classes.you'll LOVE it!

If you must take Organic and this guy is the one who's teaching, thank God for being lucky.  He's THE best Organic Prof.  In all honesty, the NO memorizing technique is GREAT for his class, but screws you over in a way cuz unless u have him for CHEM 282, you'll have to know the names for other profs

This guy should be the gold standard for teachers everwhere! He puts a lot of effort into making notes for lecture; often when the book confuses me, I just go to my notes and bam, instant clairity. Also, he doesn't get bogged down on all the little details and just goes for the big picture.GreatProf

The best prof ever!!!!!!!!  It sux he's not teaching for another 3 years cuz he is unbelievabely good.  I hate chem, but he actually made organic chem interesting and easy to understand.  He's so awesome.

Can you say, best prof ever?? I mean seriously, Ok..simple as this! We need more profs like this at SFU! He makes organic chem FUN, do I need to say more? He is clear, interesting, fair, not tricky and HOT. I am so glad I took his class, but too bad he is not teaching till 2008 b/c of his research.

The best prof i've ever had so far. He's interesting, clear, and very helpful during office hours. When he lectures, it's like he's having a casual conversation with you. So he speaks in a way that you can easily understand. Focuses on concepts, not memorization.

Amazing professor who explains with great clarity and precision. Doesn't give you **** info you don't need to know. Tests are on concepts. Also, it's easy to pay attention in class because a) he relates the material to the rest of the world in an interesting way and b) he is bloody good looking.
By far one of the best prof's sfu has to offer. Very brilliant, and esay to follow. One of those prof's that you will never forget..
AWESOME PROF!!! very clear and informative during lectures, and cares about students. second midterm was REALLY hard though.
awesome prof
Very dedicated. Made this bio prerequisite enjoyable and interesting. Great course.
Simply the best

so far the best prof at sfu i've ever had. he shows the class real-world examples that are actually interesting. his notes are awesome. and he gives bonus questions that are challenging. would highly recommend. i wish he taught all my chem courses.
interesting lectures without getting off topic
Best teaching prof.  A very very intelligent man, yet he never makes you feel intimidated.
No Comments
branda's a great prof. no memorization. you just gotta understand the concepts, 'cause that's what's important anyways.
Bertuzzi was awesome!. He's great guy, explains things so so well. Tests are a little hard but if u do the homework you'll be fine.
he is very helpful, and encourage you to ask questions, his lecture was great.
No Comments
Awesome teacher - very helpful, always reviews previous lecture, focuses on concepts (not math!)
No Comments
Though hard exams, the best prof I ever have.
doesn't look like your typical chemistry prof. he reminds me of todd bertuzzi.
Very hard on the final exam !!!!!!!!
Great Prof at explanations. No homework but if avg is high, will give hard test.
